Question
========

A dataset contains three categorical variables measured in a sample of teachers working in elementary school in Utrecht: Education ($X_{1};\;0 = reguliere\;PABO,\;1 = universitaire\;PABO$), Type of class ($X_{2};\;0 = Onderbouw,\;1 = Middenbouw,\;2 = Bovenbouw$) and Type of school ($Y;\;0 = Openbaar,\;1 = Confessioneel\;bijzonder,\;2 = Algemeen\;bijzonder$).

What type of analysis can be used to examine whether there is a relationship between Education and Type of School, statistically controlled for Type of Class? 
Answerlist
----------
* Ordinal logistic regression with interaction.
* Ordinal logistic regression without interaction.
* Multinomial logistic regression with interaction.
* Multinomial logistic regression without interaction.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Correct
